result.execSummary:
The defendant John Thomas Wills was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Thomas Wills in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties do not object to revocation summary.  State requests court follow recommendation and costs and restitution be paid from huber funds and then be coverted to civil judgment.  Atty Dolch requests six month jail sentence.  Does not object to repayment of funds.  DE makes statement.  
Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:

All unpaid court costs and restitution to be coverted to civil judgment
10 Months in Sauk County Jail, with huber.  Commence FORTHWITH
138 days jail credit

Paperwork handed in court.

Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Defendant John Thomas Wills in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing to be done outside 1 p.m. calendar.  To be set by Br. 3.  Bond continues.
Sentencing hearing at 11-18-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant John Thomas Wills in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hughes states matter is resolved.  State states the matter is resolved but DE needs to do inpatient program at St Clare Center but he hasn't done that as yet.  Requests reset for plea/sent.  15CF178 would also track w/this one.  Bond continued in both matters.  State states agreement.  15CF178 - NC.  15CF207 would be dismissed/read-in.  Probation for 24 months w/conditions of costs of $528.00 and DNA sample and restitution as agreed.  Jail as condition for 90 days if no treatment done...30 days if treatment is done.  Requests plea today and sentencing out 30 days or so in 15CF178.  Atty Hughes is in agreement.  DE is in agreement.  Atty Hughes enters NC plea to Ct 1 in 15CF178.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  15CF207 is dismissed/read-in.  15CF178 is set for sentencing.  DE advised of voting and appeal rights and felony firearm warnings.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

DE unable to be heard due to electricty out.  Counsel requests continuance.  No comment by State.  Court grants continuance.

Defendant John Thomas Wills in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney ORourke advises court defendant is requesting new counsel in this matter.  Defendant was given instruction on how to do that with the PD office.  State gives status, CSR to be removed if no agreement today.  Court allows Attorney ORourke to withdraw.    Trial will remain on the calendar.  New address provided.
